alert.note: Alert for Dorado; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Vega Alta; Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 06 at 2:05AM AST until February 06 at 4:15AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Dorado in Puerto Rico... Toa Alta in Puerto Rico... Toa Baja in Puerto Rico... Vega Alta in Puerto Rico... Vega Baja in Puerto Rico... * Until 415 AM AST. * At 205 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain will continue across the warned area. So far Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch or more will remain possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. Additional rains will only aggravate these conditions. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and emergency managers. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Dorado; Toa Alta; Toa Baja; Vega Alta; Vega Baja
